meanings.definition: To involve in difficulties or complications.
meanings.sent1: She found herself entoiling in a web of lies.
meanings.sent2: The project became entoiling when unexpected issues arose.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician kept entoiling himself in his own tricks.
meanings.sent4: The detective felt entoiled in a mystery with no clear solution.
meanings.sent5: The spider skillfully entoiled its prey in silk threads.

meanings.definition: To ensnare or trap in a net or snare.
meanings.sent1: The hunter succeeded in entoiling the elusive rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The spider was entoiling insects in its intricate web.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat enjoyed entoiling yarn around the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman felt entoiled by the fishing line caught on a rock.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was expertly entoiling unsuspecting flies.
